pages.title: Things To Do In Delhi — 2026 Guide
pages.contentDirection: Comprehensive hub linking to all categories below. 2,500-3,000 words, links to every category page.

pages.title: Is 2 days enough for Delhi?
pages.contentDirection: Yes for highlights, no for depth. Provide 2-day itinerary. Link to 'how to spend 3 days' page.

pages.title: How to spend 3 days in Delhi?
pages.contentDirection: Day-by-day itinerary. Day 1: Old Delhi. Day 2: New Delhi monuments. Day 3: South Delhi + experiences.

pages.title: How to spend 1 day in Delhi?
pages.contentDirection: Tight itinerary. Morning: Old Delhi (Red Fort, Chandni Chowk, Jama Masjid). Afternoon: Humayun's Tomb, Lodhi Gardens. Evening: Connaught Place.

pages.title: How many days do you need in Delhi?
pages.contentDirection: 2-3 days minimum. 4-5 to go deeper. Explain what you can cover in each timeframe.

pages.title: What is Delhi best known for?
pages.contentDirection: History (7 ancient cities), street food, Mughal architecture, markets, political capital.

pages.title: What is the most visited place in Delhi?
pages.contentDirection: Red Fort, Qutub Minar, India Gate. Include visitor numbers if available.

pages.title: Is Delhi worth visiting?
pages.contentDirection: Yes, but set expectations. Not a beach holiday. Chaos is the point. What makes it unique.

pages.title: What is the best time to visit Delhi?
pages.contentDirection: October-March (cool season). Avoid April-June (extreme heat 45°C+). Monsoon July-Sept (humid but fewer crowds).

pages.title: What is the best month to visit Delhi?
pages.contentDirection: November or February. November: post-monsoon freshness, Diwali. February: pleasant, Delhi Lit Fest.

pages.title: Is Delhi safe for tourists?
pages.contentDirection: Generally yes. Petty theft/scams are main risk. Metro is safe. Avoid isolated areas at night. Use Uber/Ola not street taxis.

pages.title: Is Delhi safe for solo female travellers?
pages.contentDirection: Dress modestly, use women's metro carriage, Uber/Ola at night, stick to populated areas. Thousands do it safely.

pages.title: Is Delhi safe at night?
pages.contentDirection: Parts of it. South Delhi, Connaught Place, Khan Market area are fine. Avoid Paharganj, Old Delhi lanes after dark.

pages.title: What should I avoid in Delhi?
pages.contentDirection: Street taxis (use Uber), tap water, walking alone at night in quiet areas, aggressive touts near Red Fort/Jama Masjid.

pages.title: Is Delhi expensive?
pages.contentDirection: Cheap by Western standards. Budget ₹2,000-3,000/day ($25-35). Mid-range ₹5,000-10,000/day. Luxury ₹15,000+.

pages.title: How much money do I need per day in Delhi?
pages.contentDirection: Break down: accommodation, food, transport, entry fees. Budget/mid/luxury tiers.

pages.title: Where should I stay in Delhi as a tourist?
pages.contentDirection: Connaught Place (central, walkable), Karol Bagh (budget), South Delhi (upscale, safe), Paharganj (backpacker but rough).

pages.title: How do I get from Delhi airport to the city?
pages.contentDirection: Airport Express Metro (fastest, ₹60, 20 mins to New Delhi station), Uber/Ola (₹300-500), prepaid taxi (₹400-600).

pages.title: Can you drink tap water in Delhi?
pages.contentDirection: No. Bottled water only. Avoid ice in street stalls. RO filtered water in restaurants is fine.

pages.title: What is Delhi belly and how to avoid it?
pages.contentDirection: Traveller's diarrhea. Bottled water, avoid raw salads, eat at busy stalls (high turnover = fresh food), carry Imodium.

pages.title: What should I pack for Delhi?
pages.contentDirection: Season-dependent. Winter: layers, it gets cold. Summer: light cotton. Always: modest clothing for temples, comfortable walking shoes, sunscreen.

pages.title: Do I need a visa for India?
pages.contentDirection: Most nationalities need e-visa. Apply online 4+ days before. 30-day tourist visa available. Link to official site.

pages.title: Is Uber available in Delhi?
pages.contentDirection: Yes. Uber and Ola both work. Download both apps. Need Indian SIM for OTP verification (get at airport).

pages.title: How to get around Delhi?
pages.contentDirection: Metro (best), Uber/Ola (door to door), auto rickshaws (short trips, bargain first), avoid city buses and street taxis.

pages.title: Best Food Tours In Delhi — 2026 Guide
pages.contentDirection: Overview of food tour options, areas, price ranges. Feature: Old Delhi food walks, cooking classes, specific operators.

pages.title: What food is Delhi famous for?
pages.contentDirection: Chaat, chole bhature, parathas (Paranthe Wali Gali), kebabs (Karim's), butter chicken (origin city), biryani, jalebis.

pages.title: What is the best street food in Delhi?
pages.contentDirection: Top 10-15 dishes with where to find each. Golgappe, aloo tikki, dahi bhalle, ram ladoo, chhole kulche.

pages.title: Where to eat in Old Delhi?
pages.contentDirection: Karim's (kebabs since 1913), Paranthe Wali Gali, Al Jawahar, Natraj Dahi Bhalle, Haji Mohd Hussain (fried chicken).

pages.title: Is street food safe in Delhi?
pages.contentDirection: Mostly yes if you pick busy stalls. High turnover = fresh food. Avoid pre-cut fruit, tap water ice. Start mild, build tolerance.

pages.title: How much does a food tour cost in Delhi?
pages.contentDirection: ₹1,500-3,500 ($18-42) for 3-4 hour walk. Includes 8-12 tastings. Private tours ₹3,000-6,000.

pages.title: Which area in Delhi has the best food?
pages.contentDirection: Old Delhi (Chandni Chowk) for street food. Nizamuddin for Mughlai. Connaught Place for restaurants. Defence Colony for modern.

pages.title: What is Paranthe Wali Gali?
pages.contentDirection: Famous alley in Chandni Chowk serving stuffed parathas since 1870s. 5-6 shops. Go morning for best experience.

pages.title: Best restaurants in Delhi?
pages.contentDirection: Indian Accent (fine dining, contemporary), Bukhara (dal makhani, ITC Maurya), Karim's (Mughlai), SodaBottleOpenerWala (Parsi).

pages.title: Best cooking classes in Delhi?
pages.contentDirection: Overview of options. Home cooking experiences, professional classes, market tour + cook combos. Price range ₹2,000-5,000.

pages.title: Is Delhi vegetarian friendly?
pages.contentDirection: Extremely. Huge vegetarian culture. Most restaurants have extensive veg menus. Look for 'pure veg' signs.

pages.title: Where to drink craft beer in Delhi?
pages.contentDirection: Breweries: Bira 91 Taproom, Ek Bar, Cocktails and Dreams, Raasta. Beer prices ₹300-600 per pint.

pages.title: Best cafes in Delhi?
pages.contentDirection: Indian Coffee House (Connaught Place, historic), Blue Tokai (speciality coffee), Kunzum Travel Cafe (Hauz Khas), Triveni Terrace Cafe.

pages.title: What is butter chicken and where was it invented?
pages.contentDirection: Origin story: Kundan Lal Gujral, Moti Mahal, 1947. Where to eat authentic butter chicken in Delhi today.

pages.title: Best biryani in Delhi?
pages.contentDirection: Al Jawahar (near Jama Masjid), Biryani By Kilo (delivery), Dum Pukht (ITC Maurya, luxury).

pages.title: Best Heritage Walks In Delhi — 2026 Guide
pages.contentDirection: Walking tour options, self-guided routes, guided options.

pages.title: How many heritage sites are in Delhi?
pages.contentDirection: 174 ASI-protected monuments. 3 UNESCO sites (Red Fort, Humayun's Tomb, Qutub Minar). More than any other Indian city.

pages.title: What are the UNESCO World Heritage Sites in Delhi?
pages.contentDirection: Red Fort, Humayun's Tomb, Qutub Minar complex. Details on each, visiting tips.

pages.title: How old is Delhi?
pages.contentDirection: Inhabited since 6th century BC (Indraprastha, Mahabharata). 7 historic cities of Delhi. Modern city founded 1911 (New Delhi).

pages.title: What are the 7 cities of Delhi?
pages.contentDirection: Lal Kot, Siri, Tughlaqabad, Jahanpanah, Firozabad, Dinpanah/Shergarh, Shahjahanabad. Brief history of each.

pages.title: Is Red Fort worth visiting?
pages.contentDirection: Yes but go early (opens 9:30, skip Mondays). Sound and light show evenings. ₹35 Indians, ₹500 foreigners.

pages.title: How long do you need at Red Fort?
pages.contentDirection: 1.5-2 hours. Add 30 mins for museum. Combine with Chandni Chowk and Jama Masjid (all walkable).

pages.title: Humayun's Tomb vs Taj Mahal — what's the difference?
pages.contentDirection: Humayun's Tomb came first (1570), inspired Taj Mahal (1653). Smaller, less crowded, arguably better for photos.

pages.title: What is Agrasen ki Baoli?
pages.contentDirection: 14th century stepwell in Connaught Place. Free entry. Featured in PK (Bollywood film). Atmospheric, good for photography.

pages.title: Is Qutub Minar worth visiting?
pages.contentDirection: Yes. 73m tall, 12th century, stunning carvings. ₹35/₹550. Go morning for best light. Combine with Mehrauli Archaeological Park.

pages.title: Best free things to do in Delhi?
pages.contentDirection: Gurudwara Bangla Sahib, Lodhi Gardens, Lodhi Art District murals, Dilli Haat (₹30 entry), India Gate, Sunder Nursery.

pages.title: What is Mehrauli Archaeological Park?
pages.contentDirection: 440 monuments in overgrown forest adjacent to Qutub Minar. Free entry. Rarely visited. One of Delhi's true hidden spots.

pages.title: Best museums in Delhi?
pages.contentDirection: National Museum (free), National Gallery of Modern Art, Partition Museum, Crafts Museum, Gandhi Smriti.

pages.title: Where to see Mughal architecture in Delhi?
pages.contentDirection: Red Fort, Humayun's Tomb, Jama Masjid, Purana Qila, Safdarjung's Tomb, Nizamuddin Dargah.

pages.title: Self-guided walking tour Old Delhi?
pages.contentDirection: Route: Chandni Chowk metro → Red Fort → Chandni Chowk bazaar → Paranthe Wali Gali → Spice Market → Jama Masjid. 3-4 hours.

pages.title: Best Markets In Delhi — Shopping Guide 2026
pages.contentDirection: All major markets, what each is known for, pricing, bargaining tips.

pages.title: What are the best markets in Delhi?
pages.contentDirection: Chandni Chowk (everything), Khan Market (upscale), Sarojini Nagar (fashion bargains), Dilli Haat (handicrafts), Janpath (souvenirs).

pages.title: What to buy in Delhi as souvenirs?
pages.contentDirection: Spices (Khari Baoli), textiles/scarves, miniature paintings, brass/copperware, Ayurvedic products, tea.

pages.title: Is bargaining expected in Delhi markets?
pages.contentDirection: Yes in street markets (start at 50% of asking). No in malls/fixed-price shops. Dilli Haat has some room. Khan Market is fixed.

pages.title: What is Dilli Haat?
pages.contentDirection: Open-air crafts bazaar. ₹30 entry. Handicrafts from all Indian states. Food stalls by state. INA metro station.

pages.title: What is the biggest market in Delhi?
pages.contentDirection: Chandni Chowk — one of Asia's largest and oldest markets. Each lane specialises: textiles, electronics, spices, jewellery.

pages.title: Where to buy spices in Delhi?
pages.contentDirection: Khari Baoli (Asia's largest spice market). Buy whole spices, freshly ground. Prices fraction of supermarket.

pages.title: Best place to buy clothes in Delhi?
pages.contentDirection: Budget: Sarojini Nagar, Lajpat Nagar. Mid: Select Citywalk, Khan Market. Designer: Hauz Khas Village boutiques.

pages.title: Is Khan Market expensive?
pages.contentDirection: Most expensive retail area in India. Boutiques, bookshops, cafes. Worth visiting for atmosphere even without buying.

pages.title: Best Day Trips From Delhi — 2026 Guide
pages.contentDirection: Options within 2-5 hours drive.

pages.title: Can you do a day trip from Delhi to Agra?
pages.contentDirection: Yes, 3-4 hours by road/train. Gatimaan Express (fastest, 1hr 40min). Leave early, see Taj at sunrise, return evening.

pages.title: Can you do a day trip from Delhi to Jaipur?
pages.contentDirection: Possible but long (5-6 hours each way). Better as overnight. If insistent, Shatabdi Express 4.5 hours each way.

pages.title: Best weekend trips from Delhi?
pages.contentDirection: Agra, Jaipur, Rishikesh, Neemrana Fort, Mathura/Vrindavan, Bharatpur bird sanctuary, Jim Corbett.

pages.title: How to get from Delhi to Agra?
pages.contentDirection: Train (Gatimaan Express, ₹750-1,500), car (3-4 hours, ₹3,000-4,000 return with driver), bus (not recommended).

pages.title: Is Neemrana Fort worth visiting from Delhi?
pages.contentDirection: Yes, 2 hours drive. Stunning heritage hotel, zip-lining over the fort, pool, Rajasthani food. Day visit or overnight.

pages.title: Day trip to Mathura and Vrindavan from Delhi?
pages.contentDirection: 3 hours drive. Krishna's birthplace. Temples, ghats, street food. Best during Holi (March).

pages.title: Best Experiences In Delhi — Beyond Sightseeing 2026
pages.contentDirection: Cooking classes, craft workshops, cycling tours, photography walks.

pages.title: Best cooking classes in Delhi?
pages.contentDirection: Home cooking with local families (most authentic), Saffron Palate, Tastesutra. ₹2,000-5,000 per person.

pages.title: Can you do a cycling tour in Delhi?
pages.contentDirection: Yes. Delhi By Cycle runs early morning rides through Old Delhi. ₹1,500-2,000. Start 6am before traffic.

pages.title: Best photography spots in Delhi?
pages.contentDirection: Humayun's Tomb (golden hour), Lodhi Art District (murals), Chandni Chowk (street photography), Agrasen ki Baoli.

pages.title: Where to see street art in Delhi?
pages.contentDirection: Lodhi Colony Art District. 50+ murals from international artists. Free, walkable. St+Art India Foundation project.

pages.title: Yoga classes in Delhi for tourists?
pages.contentDirection: Sivananda Yoga Centre, Yoga Kshema, studios in Hauz Khas. Drop-in classes ₹500-1,000. Multi-day workshops available.

pages.title: Where to hear live Sufi music in Delhi?
pages.contentDirection: Nizamuddin Dargah, Thursday evenings. Qawwali performances. Free. Also: Hazrat Bakhtiyar Kaki Dargah in Mehrauli.

pages.title: Bollywood experience in Delhi?
pages.contentDirection: Watch a film at PVR or Raj Mandir-style cinema. Bollywood dance classes. Kingdom of Dreams (Gurgaon, 30 min from Delhi).

pages.title: Is there a pub crawl in Delhi?
pages.contentDirection: Yes, organised pub crawls in Connaught Place/Hauz Khas. Also DIY: Hauz Khas Village has 15+ bars within walking distance.

pages.title: Best nightlife in Delhi?
pages.contentDirection: Hauz Khas Village (bars/clubs), Connaught Place (lounges), Cyber Hub Gurgaon (upscale). Most close by 1am.

pages.title: Things to do in Delhi with kids?
pages.contentDirection: National Science Centre, Delhi Zoo, Akshardham Temple, Rail Museum, Adventure Island. Most under ₹200 entry.

pages.title: Romantic things to do in Delhi?
pages.contentDirection: Lodhi Gardens sunset, dinner at Indian Accent, Sunder Nursery walk, rooftop dining Connaught Place.

pages.title: Things to do in Delhi at night?
pages.contentDirection: India Gate (illuminated), Connaught Place dinner, Hauz Khas nightlife, Old Delhi night food walk, Akshardham fountain show.

pages.title: Things to do in Delhi when it rains?
pages.contentDirection: Museums (National Museum free), shopping malls (Select Citywalk), cooking class, spa, cafe-hopping Khan Market.

pages.title: Things to do in Delhi in summer?
pages.contentDirection: Indoor options: museums, malls, cooking classes. Kingdom of Dreams (AC). If outdoors: go very early morning. Water parks.

pages.title: Things to do in Delhi in winter?
pages.contentDirection: Best season. Everything is accessible. Lodhi Gardens walks, Old Delhi food tours, rooftop dining, Surajkund Mela (Feb).

pages.title: How to use Delhi Metro?
pages.contentDirection: Buy token or get Metro card. Security check at every station. Women's carriage (first in direction of travel). Map + fare info.

pages.title: Delhi Metro map and tips for tourists?
pages.contentDirection: Key stations: Rajiv Chowk (CP), Chandni Chowk, Kashmere Gate, Hauz Khas, Airport Express. ₹10-60 per journey.

pages.title: Best SIM card for tourists in Delhi?
pages.contentDirection: Airtel or Jio. Buy at airport (₹500-700, includes data). Need passport photo + passport copy. Takes 2-24 hours to activate.

pages.title: How to avoid scams in Delhi?
pages.contentDirection: Top scams: 'your hotel is closed' taxi scam, gem scam, fake tourist office near New Delhi station. Ignore unsolicited help.

pages.title: Do I need to tip in Delhi?
pages.contentDirection: 10% at restaurants if no service charge. Round up for auto drivers. ₹50-100 for guides/porters. Not expected at street food stalls.

pages.title: What language do they speak in Delhi?
pages.contentDirection: Hindi primarily. English widely understood in tourist areas, hotels, restaurants. Some Punjabi and Urdu.

pages.title: What currency does Delhi use?
pages.contentDirection: Indian Rupee (INR/₹). ATMs everywhere. Cards accepted at most restaurants/shops. Carry cash for markets/autos.

pages.title: Is Delhi polluted?
pages.contentDirection: Yes, especially November-January (worst air quality globally). Check AQI before visiting. Wear N95 mask if >200 AQI.

pages.title: What is the weather like in Delhi?
pages.contentDirection: Extreme seasons. Summers 45°C+, winters can drop to 2°C, monsoon July-Sept. Best: Oct-Mar.

pages.title: Things to do in Old Delhi / Chandni Chowk?
pages.contentDirection: Red Fort, Jama Masjid, Paranthe Wali Gali, spice market, cycle rickshaw ride, bazaar exploration.

pages.title: Things to do in Connaught Place?
pages.contentDirection: Agrasen ki Baoli, Jantar Mantar, shopping, restaurants, nightlife. Central hub, walkable, metro-connected.

pages.title: Things to do in Hauz Khas?
pages.contentDirection: Hauz Khas Complex ruins, Deer Park, boutique shopping, bars and nightlife, art galleries.

pages.title: Things to do in South Delhi?
pages.contentDirection: Qutub Minar, Mehrauli village, Lodhi Gardens, Khan Market, Sunder Nursery, art galleries.

pages.title: Things to do in Nizamuddin?
pages.contentDirection: Nizamuddin Dargah (Sufi shrine), Humayun's Tomb, Sunder Nursery, Nizamuddin Basti food.

pages.title: Things to do in Karol Bagh?
pages.contentDirection: Budget shopping, street food, Hanuman Temple (112ft statue), Ajmal Khan Road market.

pages.title: Paharganj — is it worth staying?
pages.contentDirection: Backpacker hub near New Delhi station. Cheapest accommodation. Chaotic, not for everyone. Good for budget travellers with experience.

pages.title: What festivals are celebrated in Delhi?
pages.contentDirection: Diwali (Oct/Nov), Holi (March), Republic Day (26 Jan), Dussehra (Oct), Eid, Christmas, Lohri (Jan). Calendar of dates.

pages.title: Where to celebrate Holi in Delhi?
pages.contentDirection: Organised events safer for tourists than random street celebrations. Hotel-hosted Holi parties. Mathura day trip option.

pages.title: What happens on Republic Day in Delhi?
pages.contentDirection: Military parade on Rajpath (Kartavya Path). 26 January. Tickets available online. Spectacular. Arrive very early.

pages.title: Diwali in Delhi — what to expect?
pages.contentDirection: Festival of lights, Oct/Nov. Markets decorated, fireworks, sweets everywhere. Very loud. Air quality plummets.

pages.title: What is Surajkund Mela?
pages.contentDirection: Annual crafts fair, February. Faridabad (30 min from Delhi). Handicrafts, performances, food from all states. ₹180 entry.

pages.title: Best time to visit Delhi for festivals?
pages.contentDirection: October-March covers Dussehra, Diwali, Christmas, Republic Day, Surajkund Mela, Holi. Something every month.

notes: Delhi-specific notes: 107 pages total (1 hub, 5 category pages, 101 PAA pages). Priority: Hub first, then categories, then high-volume PAA pages.
